#summary Compiling
= How to compile P3DFFT =
P3DFFT uses a configure script to create Makefiles for compiling the library as well as several examples. This page will step you through the process of running the configure script properly.

|| *Flags* || *Description* ||
|| --enable-single || compiles P3DFFT in single-precision ||
|| --enable-fftw || enables the use of the FFTW library ||
|| --with-fftw=<path to FFTW3 library> || path to FFTW library ||
|| FCFLAGS=<Fortran compiler flags> || flags to use with Fortran compiler || 
|| CFLAGS=<C compiler flags> || flags to use with C compiler ||
|| LDFLAGS=<libraries to link> || additional linker flags ||

= Compiling on Triton =
|| *Compiler* || *Modules* || *Arguments* ||
|| PGI || pgi, fftw, mpi || ./configure --enable-pgi --enable--fftw --with-fftw="$FFTWHOME" FCFLAGS="-fastsse -tp barcelona-64 -Mextend -byteswapio" CFLAGS="-fastsse -tp barcelona-64" LDFLAGS="-lmpi_f90 -lmpi_f77 -lmyriexpress" ||
|| Intel || intel, fftw, mpi || ~~./configure --enable-intel --enable-fftw --enable-dstride1 --with-fftw="$FFTWHOME" FCFLAGS="-O3 -xW -132 -fpp" CFLAGS="-O3 -xW" LDFLAGS="-lmpi_f90 -lmpi_f77 -lmyriexpress"~~ ||
|| GCC || gnu, fftw, mpi || ./configure --enable-gcc --enable-fftw --with-fftw="$FFTWHOME" LDFLAGS="-lmpi_f90 -lmpi_f77" || 


= Compiling on TACC =
|| *Compiler* || *Modules* || *Arguments* ||
|| PGI || pgi, fftw, mpi || ./configure --enable-pgi --with-fftw="$TACC_FFTW3_DIR" FCFLAGS="-fastsse -tp barcelona-64 -Mextend -byteswapio" CFLAGS="-fastsse -tp barcelona-64" LDFLAGS="-lmpi_f90 -lmpi_f77" || 

= Compiling on Kraken =
|| *Compiler* || *Modules* || *Arguments* ||
|| PGI || pgi, fftw, mpi || ./configure --enable-fftw --with-fftw="$FFTW_DIR/.." --enable-useeven --enable-stride1 --enable-pgi FC=ftn FCFLAGS="-fastsse -tp istanbul-64 -Mextend -byteswapio"  CC=cc CFLAGS="-fastsse -tp istanbul-64" ||
